newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Semiconductor industry seen strong.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Semiconductor industry seen strong.

text.p: -- Prudential Securities said it expects semiconductor companies to post March-quarter earnings that reflect continued strengthening of the overall industry and individual company fundamentals.
-- said it expects relatively few negative earnings surprises and expects most companies to meet or slightly exceed consensus earnings estimates.

-- said expects firmer dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) chip prices, low inventories at original equipment manufacturers and distributors and expanding lead times in selected products "will allow most management teams to suggest that near-term visibility has improved."

-- said Xilinx Inc and Altera Corp will benefit from better-than-expected revenue growth within the programmable logic devices market and the weaker yen. Said these companies should show slight improvement in gross margins and positive earnings surprises.
-- said LSI Logic Corp and Vitesse Semiconductor Corp should benefit from solid bookings and increasing capacity utilization levels.
-- said believes demand in the personal computer sector can be categorized as "falling within the normal expectations for seasonal weakness in the first quarter."
-- said the lack of price cuts on high-end microprocessors will lead to expanding gross margins and positive earnings for Intel Corp.
-- said it expects the above companies to post positive earnings surprises, but they will not exceed consensus estimates by more than five percent.
-- said certain pricing weakness and seasonally weak PC demand will cause Advanced Micro Devices to fall slightly short of its expectations for break-even earnings.
-- said expects the loss to be minimal and not "meaningfully"below the consensus estimate of a $0.03 per share loss.
